meanings.sent1: In the past, people in Germany used the deutschmark to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I found an old coin from Germany with the word 'deutschmark' on it.
meanings.sent3: Why did the deutschmark refuse to play cards? It didn't like change!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as valuable as a deutschmark in a sea of pennies.
meanings.sent5: The sound of 'deutschmark' always reminds me of my trip to Germany.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Germany before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: Before the euro, the deutschmark was used for buying goods in Germany.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother still keeps some old deutschmark notes as souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: Why did the deutschmark go to school? To get some 'cents'!
meanings.sent4: His words carried the weight of a deutschmark in a world of loose change.
meanings.sent5: The shiny deutschmark coin sparkled in the sunlight, a piece of history in my hand.
